feed.title: Review: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
feed.subtitle: With its expansive and highly detailed environments, innovative character creation, and a story that is fit for the silver screen, Skyrim is everything you've been waiting for and so much more.

link.title: Video: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

link.Abstract: The fifth installment in the series, Skyrim takes place two hundred years following the events of 2006’s Oblivion. Continuing the tradition of previous installments, players assume the role of an unknown prisoner, this time slated for execution. Your character also learns that Skyrim has become engulfed in a civil war, which is the final event prophesied by the Elder Scrolls before the return of the Nordic god of destruction, who will descend on the Earth in the form of an unstoppable dragon. That is, unless you can stop it.
link.title: Video: 7 Things You Should Know About The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

category.term: 4030~Bethesda Softworks LLC~The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim~The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion~Sony PlayStation3
category.label: InformQString

content.div:
Platforms: X360, PS3, PC

The Deal: Chances are, if you're a fan of role-playing games, you've sacrificed countless hours to Bethesda's blockbuster "The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion." With its brilliant storytelling, creative gameplay, and seemingly endless and detailed environments, players will still pick up the controller and wage war across Cyrodiil more than five years after the game's release. Thankfully, fighting old foes and reliving past stories is no longer needed, as Bethesda brings another title to the "Elder Scrolls" family.

The High King of Skyrim is dead, and the people are thrown into chaos as a battle for the throne ensues. Unfortunately, during this time of upheaval, a greater threat to the land has emerged: dragons. The survival of Tamriel now relies on a single person: the prophesied Dragonborn that will be able to walk among the dragons and ultimately save the world.

"The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim" is an action/role-playing game that uses open-world environments and detailed stories to immerse and entertain fantasy fans. Creating your would-be hero isn't like other RPGs, concentrating on gameplay as a means for defining your character rather than specifying it ahead of time. This allows you to break free of cliche molds such as warrior or mage and create any type of hero you wish based solely on your actions. As you progress through the game, you will also be able to build your abilities using perk trees, which grant helpful skills such as Turn Undead or Shield Bash.

It must be noted that "The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim" possesses some of the most stunning landscapes seen in a video game to date. Where most 3-D action games show silhouetted mountains as a backdrop with recycled backgrounds and buildings littering the countryside, Bethesda has utilized a game engine that allows you to wander across any piece of land you can see, including far-off mountain ranges, and creates unique buildings for every town, village and city you choose to explore.

If you're one of the millions of people who purchased a copy of "The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion" and have a love for the open-world adventures of the "Elder Scrolls" series, your moment has finally arrived. With its expansive and highly detailed environments, innovative character creation, and a story that is fit for the silver screen, "The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim" is everything you've been waiting for and so much more.

source.title: Review: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

entry.title: The top ten video games this holiday season

link.Abstract: We choose ten big blockbuster video games that will please any gamer this holiday season.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Super Mario 3D Land is one of the many blockbuster games out this holiday season. Other popular gaming franchises that have new titles out include Call of Duty and Battlefield.
link.title: Super Mario 3D Land

link.Abstract: Follow Canada.com Tech on Twitter
link.title: Follow Canada.com Tech on Twitter

link.Abstract: Photos from the launches for video games like Call Of Duty, Batman, and Mario 3D.
link.title: Gallery: Blockbuster video game launches

link.Abstract: They’re the two most popular military franchises ever created. That's right, we're talking about EA/DICE's Battlefield franchise and Activision/Treyarch's Call of Duty series. Only one can emerge victorious. To crown a winner, we evaluate the two based on five rounds. These include analyzing which has the better single-player campaign, gameplay/innovation, graphics, instruments of destruction and multiplayer experience. Let the battle begin!
link.title: Video: Video Game Showdown: Battlefield Vs. Call of Duty

link.Abstract: Video game makers are breaking out the big guns and hitting players with a barrage of dynamite titles that will compete for their devotion and entertainment dollars this holiday season.
link.title: Video game makers ready barrage of blockbusters

link.Abstract: "Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3" gives gamers an epic campaign, near-perfect gameplay and a multiplayer experience that is second to none.
link.title: Review: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3

link.Abstract: Video games publisher Electronic Arts is upbeat about Christmas holiday sales as it expects to release top titles and prepares its most high profile launch ever: "Star Wars: The Old Republic."
link.title: Electronic Arts upbeat about holiday season sales

link.Abstract: Drake’s Deception is the sequel to 2009’s Uncharted 2: Among Thieves, a game still worthy of the insurmountable praise and accolades it received. What both games do is an indescribable formula that could serve several sequels more, if needed.
link.title: Review: Uncharted 3 triumphs through action, authenticity

link.Abstract: A video about the new Batman video game Arkham City.
link.title: Video: 7 things you should know about Batman: Arkham City
